Verse: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And fear Allah and do not disgrace me."

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: But the shriek seized them at early morning.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: About what they used to do.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So exalt [ Allah ] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).

Name: The Bee
Verse: The command of Allah is coming, so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He sends down the angels, with the inspiration of His command, upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."

Name: The Bee
Verse: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once, he is a clear adversary.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And upon Allah is the direction of the [right] way, and among the various paths are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

Name: The Bee
Verse: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].

Name: The Bee
Verse: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,

Name: The Bee
Verse: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if you should count the favors of Allah , you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And those they invoke other than Allah create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Assuredly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Legends of the former peoples,"

Name: The Bee
Verse: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Those before them had already plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -

Name: The Bee
Verse: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." But, yes! Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what you used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And it will be said to those who feared Allah , "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -

Name: The Bee
Verse: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous -

Name: The Bee
Verse: The ones whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."

Name: The Bee
Verse: Do the disbelievers await [anything] except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And those who associate others with Allah say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allah and avoid Taghut." And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths [that] Allah will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?

Name: The Bee
Verse: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure?

Name: The Bee
Verse: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]? But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Have they not considered what things Allah has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah , while they are humble.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has said, "Do not take for yourselves two deities. He is but one God, so fear only Me."

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allah . Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord

Name: The Bee
Verse: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allah , you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.

Name: The Bee
Verse: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.

Name: The Bee
Verse: By Allah , We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they worship besides Allah that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So do not assert similarities to Allah . Indeed, Allah knows and you do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Allah presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah ! But most of them do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and intellect that perhaps you would be grateful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah . Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].

Name: The Bee
Verse: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They recognize the favor of Allah ; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [ Allah ].

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when those who associated others with Allah see their "partners," they will say," Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke besides You." But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they will impart to Allah that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah , over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allah , and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Whatever you have will end, but what Allah has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So when you recite the Qur'an, [first] seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.

Name: The Bee
Verse: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allah .

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muhammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches the Prophet." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allah , and it is those who are the liars.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah , and for them is a great punishment;

Name: The Bee
Verse: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to renounce their religion] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allah ] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful

Name: The Bee
Verse: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allah . So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah , if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah . But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allah . Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah , inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah .

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah .

Name: The Bee
Verse: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And be patient, [O Muhammad], and your patience is not but through Allah . And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-haram to al-Masjid al- AqÂ§a, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, "You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allah ].

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [ Allah ] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "Be you stones or iron

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed he is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Do they not see that Allah , who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say, "Praise to Allah , who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."

Name: The Cave
Verse: In which they will remain forever

Name: The Cave
Verse: And to warn those who say, " Allah has taken a son."

Name: The Cave
Verse: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?

Name: The Cave
Verse: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.

Name: The Cave
Verse: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.

Name: The Cave
Verse: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"

Name: The Cave
Verse: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah . He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."

Name: The Cave
Verse: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"

Name: The Cave
Verse: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say, " Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."

Name: The Cave
Verse: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?

Name: The Cave
Verse: But as for me, He is Allah , my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,

Name: The Cave
Verse: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,

Name: The Cave
Verse: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah , nor could he defend himself.

Name: The Cave
Verse: There the authority is [completely] for Allah , the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.

Name: The Cave
Verse: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."

Name: The Cave
Verse: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."

Name: The Cave
Verse: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."

Name: The Cave
Verse: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.

Name: The Cave
Verse: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.

Name: The Cave
Verse: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."

Name: The Cave
Verse: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.

Name: The Cave
Verse: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

Name: The Cave
Verse: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

Name: Mary
Verse: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.

Name: Mary
Verse: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.

Name: Mary
Verse: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

Name: Mary
Verse: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"

Name: Mary
Verse: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [ Allah ] in the morning and afternoon.

Name: Mary
Verse: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah

Name: Mary
Verse: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

Name: Mary
Verse: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

Name: Mary
Verse: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

Name: Mary
Verse: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah ."

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."

Name: Mary
Verse: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "

Name: Mary
Verse: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

Name: Mary
Verse: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."

Name: Mary
Verse: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

Name: Mary
Verse: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

Name: Mary
Verse: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "

Name: Mary
Verse: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

Name: Mary
Verse: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."

Name: Mary
Verse: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

Name: Mary
Verse: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive

Name: Mary
Verse: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

Name: Mary
Verse: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."

Name: Mary
Verse: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

Name: Mary
Verse: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.

Name: Mary
Verse: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

Name: Mary
Verse: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.

Name: Mary
Verse: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

Name: Mary
Verse: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

Name: Mary
Verse: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

Name: Mary
Verse: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy."

Name: Mary
Verse: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah , We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].

Name: Mary
Verse: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We raised him to a high station.

Name: Mary
Verse: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

Name: Mary
Verse: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -

Name: Mary
Verse: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

Name: Mary
Verse: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

Name: Mary
Verse: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah .

Name: Mary
Verse: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

Name: Mary
Verse: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

Name: Mary
Verse: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

Name: Mary
Verse: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

Name: Mary
Verse: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

Name: Mary
Verse: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"

Name: Mary
Verse: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

Name: Mary
Verse: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

Name: Mary
Verse: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]?"

Name: Mary
Verse: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

Name: Mary
Verse: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.

Name: Mary
Verse: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

Name: Mary
Verse: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

Name: Mary
Verse: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?

Name: Mary
Verse: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.

Name: Mary
Verse: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

Name: Mary
Verse: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

Name: Mary
Verse: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.

Name: Mary
Verse: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

Name: Mary
Verse: You have done an atrocious thing.

Name: Mary
Verse: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

Name: Mary
Verse: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

Name: Mary
Verse: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

Name: Mary
Verse: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

Name: Mary
Verse: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

Name: Mary
Verse: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

Name: Mary
Verse: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

Name: Mary
Verse: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

Name: Mary
Verse: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Ta, Ha.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: But only as a reminder for those who fear [ Allah ] -

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, I am Allah . There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And ease for me my task

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And untie the knot from my tongue

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: That they may understand my speech.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And appoint for me a minister from my family -

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Aaron, my brother.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Increase through him my strength

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And let him share my task

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: That we may exalt You much

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And remember You much.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And I produced you for Myself.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [ Allah ]."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

Name: Tâ Hâ
