Verse: Allah said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Samiri throw."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to the calf until Moses returns to us."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Your god is only Allah , except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And He will leave the earth a level plain;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So high [above all] is Allah , the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So be patient over what they say and exalt [ Allah ] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

Name: The Prophets
Verse: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: The Prophet said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We did not make the prophets forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And when its inhabitants perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah , they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah , Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him"- that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who insults your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

Name: The Prophets
Verse: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [I swear] by Allah , I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah . Then will you not use reason?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah ] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah ].

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We, of it, are recorders.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And [when] the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -

Name: The Prophets
Verse: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"

Name: The Prophets
Verse: But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: It has been decreed for every devil that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O People, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That is because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening book [from Him],

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allah . For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: "That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allah is not ever unjust to [His] servants."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And of the people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to the other direction]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He invokes instead of Allah that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Whoever should think that Allah will not support [Prophet Muhammad] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And thus have We sent the Qur'an down as verses of clear evidence and because Allah guides whom He intends.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, over all things, Witness.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And for [striking] them are maces of iron.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Every time they want to get out of Hellfire from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform Tawaf around the ancient House."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Inclining [only] to Allah , not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates with Allah - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: For you the animals marked for sacrifice are benefits for a specified term; then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And for all religion We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muhammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them, and the establishers of prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols of Allah ; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allah upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Their meat will not reach Allah , nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud deny [their prophets],

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin - and [how many] an abandoned well and [how many] a lofty palace.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: So have they not traveled through the earth and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. But Allah will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Say, "O people, I am only to you a clear warner."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: But the ones who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure - those are the companions of Hellfire.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allah abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allah makes precise His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allah the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those there will be a humiliating punishment.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Do you not see that Allah has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah , to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: For every religion We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muhammad], let the disbelievers not contend with you over the matter but invite them to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And if they dispute with you, then say, " Allah is most knowing of what you do.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah , is easy.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them. And to Allah will be returned [all] matters.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah . He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:

Name: The Believers
Verse: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who turn away from ill speech

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who are observant of zakah

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who guard their private parts

Name: The Believers
Verse: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed -

Name: The Believers
Verse: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -

Name: The Believers
Verse: Those are the inheritors

Name: The Believers
Verse: Who will inherit al-Firdaus. They will abide therein eternally.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allah , the best of creators.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then indeed, after that you are to die.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food for those who eat.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And upon them and on ships you are carried.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah ; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allah had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.

Name: The Believers
Verse: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."

Name: The Believers
Verse: So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation, and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows, put into the ship from each [creature] two mates and your family, except those for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allah who has saved us form the wrongdoing people.'

Name: The Believers
Verse: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].' "

Name: The Believers
Verse: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We produced after them a generation of others.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allah ; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?

Name: The Believers
Verse: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Life is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.

Name: The Believers
Verse: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allah , and we will not believe him."

Name: The Believers
Verse: He said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."

Name: The Believers
Verse: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We produced after them other generations.

Name: The Believers
Verse: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

Name: The Believers
Verse: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.

Name: The Believers
Verse: They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me."

Name: The Believers
Verse: But the people divided their religion among them into sects - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.

Name: The Believers
Verse: So leave them in their confusion for a time.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children

Name: The Believers
Verse: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord

Name: The Believers
Verse: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord -

Name: The Believers
Verse: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.

Name: The Believers
Verse: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides disbelief which they are doing,

Name: The Believers
Verse: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah ] for help.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.

Name: The Believers
Verse: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels

Name: The Believers
Verse: In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then have they not reflected over the Qur'an, or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Or do they say, "In him is madness?" Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

Name: The Believers
Verse: But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.

Name: The Believers
Verse: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]

Name: The Believers
Verse: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.

Name: The Believers
Verse: They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

Name: The Believers
Verse: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, "To Allah ." Say, "Then will you not remember?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, "[They belong] to Allah ." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, "[All belongs] to Allah ." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe [concerning Him].

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,

Name: The Believers
Verse: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

Name: The Believers
Verse: And indeed, We are able to show you what We have promised them.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,

Name: The Believers
Verse: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord , lest they be present with me."

Name: The Believers
Verse: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.

Name: The Believers
Verse: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.

Name: The Believers
Verse: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.

Name: The Believers
Verse: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."

Name: The Believers
Verse: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'

Name: The Believers
Verse: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."

Name: The Believers
Verse: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: So exalted is Allah , the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And, [O Muhammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."

Name: Light
Verse: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion of Allah , if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

Name: Light
Verse: The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator or a polytheist, and that has been made unlawful to the believers.

Name: Light
Verse: And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,

Name: Light
Verse: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform, for indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: Light
Verse: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the truthful.

Name: Light
Verse: And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allah be upon him if he should be among the liars.

Name: Light
Verse: But it will prevent punishment from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the liars.

Name: Light
Verse: And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he was of the truthful.

Name: Light
Verse: And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercyand because Allah is Accepting of repentance and Wise.

Name: Light
Verse: Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof for him is a great punishment.

Name: Light
Verse: Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and believing women think good of one another and say, This is an obvious falsehood?

Name: Light
Verse: Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allah, who are the liars.

Name: Light
Verse: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved by a great punishment

Name: Light
Verse: When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allah, tremendous.

Name: Light
Verse: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allah]; this is a great slander?

Name: Light
Verse: Allah warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.

Name: Light
Verse: And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Name: Light
Verse: Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows and you do not know.

Name: Light
Verse: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercyand because Allah is Kind and Merciful.

Name: Light
Verse: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allah purifies whom He wills, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Name: Light
Verse: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allah, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: Light
Verse: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment

Name: Light
Verse: On a Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.

Name: Light
Verse: That Day, Allah will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is Allah who is the perfect in justice.

Name: Light
Verse: Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words. Those [good people] are declared innocent of what the slanderers say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.

Name: Light
Verse: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.

Name: Light
Verse: And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if it is said to you, Go back, then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.

Name: Light
Verse: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

Name: Light
Verse: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do.

Name: Light
Verse: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands fathers, their sons, their husbands sons, their brothers, their brothers sons, their sisters sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.

Name: Light
Verse: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

Name: Light
Verse: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: Light
Verse: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allah.

Name: Light
Verse: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.

Name: Light
Verse: That Allah may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

Name: Light
Verse: But those who disbelieved their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allah is swift in account.

Name: Light
Verse: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light for him there is no light.

Name: Light
Verse: Do you not see that Allah is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allah is Knowing of what they do.

Name: Light
Verse: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the destination.

Name: Light
Verse: Do you not see that Allah drives clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost takes away the eyesight.

Name: Light
Verse: Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.

Name: Light
Verse: Allah has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

Name: Light
Verse: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

Name: Light
Verse: But the hypocrites say, We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.

Name: Light
Verse: And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].

Name: Light
Verse: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.

Name: Light
Verse: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.

Name: Light
Verse: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, We hear and we obey. And those are the successful.

Name: Light
Verse: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him it is those who are the attainers.

Name: Light
Verse: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allahs cause]. Say, Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do.

Name: Light
Verse: Say, Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification.

Name: Light
Verse: Allah has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them,after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that then those are the defiantly disobedient.

Name: Light
Verse: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger that you may receive mercy.

Name: Light
Verse: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allah] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire and how wretched the destination.

Name: Light
Verse: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you some of you, among others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Name: Light
Verse: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Name: Light
Verse: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Name: Light
Verse: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your fathers brothers or the houses of your fathers sisters or the houses of your mothers brothers or the houses of your mothers sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.

Name: Light
Verse: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Mu?ammad] those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: Light
Verse: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from the Prophets order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.

Name: Light
Verse: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -

Name: The Criterion
Verse: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"

Name: The Criterion
Verse: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?

Name: The Criterion
Verse: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water

Name: The Criterion
Verse: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].

Name: The Criterion
Verse: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [ Allah ] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -

Name: The Criterion
Verse: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.

Name: The Criterion
