Verse: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Ta, Seen, Meem.

Name: The Poets
Verse: These are the verses of the clear Book.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.

Name: The Poets
Verse: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -

Name: The Poets
Verse: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah ?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me

Name: The Poets
Verse: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."

Name: The Poets
Verse: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

Name: The Poets
Verse: And [then] you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful."

Name: The Poets
Verse: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

Name: The Poets
Verse: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."

Name: The Poets
Verse: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate

Name: The Poets
Verse: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."

Name: The Poets
Verse: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."

Name: The Poets
Verse: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah ].

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

Name: The Poets
Verse: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, they are enraging us,

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We removed them from gardens and springs

Name: The Poets
Verse: And treasures and honorable station -

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So they pursued them at sunrise.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then We drowned the others.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

Name: The Poets
Verse: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,

Name: The Poets
Verse: You and your ancient forefathers?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,

Name: The Poets
Verse: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me

Name: The Poets
Verse: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life

Name: The Poets
Verse: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."

Name: The Poets
Verse: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -

Name: The Poets
Verse: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

Name: The Poets
Verse: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."

Name: The Poets
Verse: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,

Name: The Poets
Verse: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship

Name: The Poets
Verse: Other than Allah ? Can they help you or help themselves?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators

Name: The Poets
Verse: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They will say while they dispute therein,

Name: The Poets
Verse: "By Allah , we were indeed in manifest error

Name: The Poets
Verse: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And no one misguided us except the criminals.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So now we have no intercessors

Name: The Poets
Verse: And not a devoted friend.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The people of Noah denied the messengers

Name: The Poets
Verse: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah ?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I am not one to drive away the believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I am only a clear warner."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: 'Aad denied the messengers

Name: The Poets
Verse: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah ?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,

Name: The Poets
Verse: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?

Name: The Poets
Verse: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,

Name: The Poets
Verse: Provided you with grazing livestock and children

Name: The Poets
Verse: And gardens and springs.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.

Name: The Poets
Verse: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,

Name: The Poets
Verse: And we are not to be punished."

Name: The Poets
Verse: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thamud denied the messengers

Name: The Poets
Verse: When their brother salih said to them, "Will you not fear Allah ?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],

Name: The Poets
Verse: Within gardens and springs

Name: The Poets
Verse: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

Name: The Poets
Verse: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

Name: The Poets
Verse: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

Name: The Poets
Verse: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."

Name: The Poets
Verse: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The people of Lot denied the messengers

Name: The Poets
Verse: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah ?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Do you approach males among the worlds

Name: The Poets
Verse: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].

Name: The Poets
Verse: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We saved him and his family, all,

Name: The Poets
Verse: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then We destroyed the others.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers

Name: The Poets
Verse: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah ?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear Allah and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And weigh with an even balance.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And fear He who created you and the former creation."

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

Name: The Poets
Verse: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."

Name: The Poets
Verse: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down

Name: The Poets
Verse: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -

Name: The Poets
Verse: In a clear Arabic language.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

Name: The Poets
Verse: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners

Name: The Poets
Verse: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"

Name: The Poets
Verse: So for Our punishment are they impatient?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years

Name: The Poets
Verse: And then there came to them that which they were promised?

Name: The Poets
Verse: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners

Name: The Poets
Verse: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.

Name: The Poets
Verse: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."

Name: The Poets
Verse: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

Name: The Poets
Verse: Who sees you when you arise

Name: The Poets
Verse: And your movement among those who prostrate.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

Name: The Poets
Verse: They descend upon every sinful liar.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;

Name: The Poets
Verse: Do you not see that in every valley they roam

Name: The Poets
Verse: And that they say what they do not do? -

Name: The Poets
Verse: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book

Name: The Ant
Verse: As guidance and good tidings for the believers

Name: The Ant
Verse: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allah , Lord of the worlds.

Name: The Ant
Verse: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah , the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [ Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when there came to them Our visible signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allah , who has favored us over many of His believing servants."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And Solomon inherited David. He said, "O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not."

Name: The Ant
Verse: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?

Name: The Ant
Verse: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization."

Name: The Ant
Verse: But the hoopoe stayed not long and said, "I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.

Name: The Ant
Verse: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah , and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,

Name: The Ant
Verse: Allah - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne."

Name: The Ant
Verse: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return."

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: 'In the name of Allah , the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,

Name: The Ant
Verse: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].' "

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, "We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command."

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, "Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."

Name: The Ant
Verse: So when they came to Solomon, he said, "Do you provide me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Return to them, for we will surely come to them with soldiers that they will be powerless to encounter, and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation, and they will be debased."

Name: The Ant
Verse: A powerful one from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy."

Name: The Ant
Verse: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, "This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever is ungrateful - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous."

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, "Disguise for her her throne; we will see whether she will be guided [to truth] or will be of those who is not guided."

Name: The Ant
Verse: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], "Is your throne like this?" She said, "[It is] as though it was it." [Solomon said], "And we were given knowledge before her, and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allah ].

Name: The Ant
Verse: And that which she was worshipping other than Allah had averted her [from submission to Him]. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people."

Name: The Ant
Verse: She was told, "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water and uncovered her shins [to wade through]. He said, "Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass." She said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah , Lord of the worlds."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We had certainly sent to Thamud their brother salih, [saying], "Worship Allah ," and at once they were two parties conflicting.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, "O my people, why are you impatient for evil instead of good? Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allah that you may receive mercy?"

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, "We consider you a bad omen, you and those with you." He said, "Your omen is with Allah . Rather, you are a people being tested."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, "Take a mutual oath by Allah that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.' "

Name: The Ant
Verse: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah .

Name: The Ant
Verse: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit immorality while you are seeing?

Name: The Ant
Verse: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly."

Name: The Ant
Verse: But the answer of his people was not except that they said, "Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure."

Name: The Ant
Verse: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "Praise be to Allah , and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or what they associate with Him?"

Name: The Ant
Verse: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground and placed within it rivers and made for it firmly set mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allah ? [No], but most of them do not know.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allah ? Little do you remember.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Is He [not best] who guides you through the darknesses of the land and sea and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy? Is there a deity with Allah ? High is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Is He [not best] who begins creation and then repeats it and who provides for you from the heaven and earth? Is there a deity with Allah ? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say, "None in the heavens and earth knows the unseen except Allah , and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected."

Name: The Ant
Verse: Rather, their knowledge is arrested concerning the Hereafter. Rather, they are in doubt about it. Rather, they are, concerning it, blind.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, "When we have become dust as well as our forefathers, will we indeed be brought out [of the graves]?

Name: The Ant
Verse: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before. This is not but legends of the former peoples."

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of the criminals."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And grieve not over them or be in distress from what they conspire.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And they say, "When is [the fulfillment of] this promise, if you should be truthful?"

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say, "Perhaps it is close behind you - some of that for which you are impatient.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And indeed, your Lord is full of bounty for the people, but most of them do not show gratitude."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And indeed, your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And there is nothing concealed within the heaven and the earth except that it is in a clear Register.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed, this Qur'an relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they disagree.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them by His [wise] judgement. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So rely upon Allah ; indeed, you are upon the clear truth.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs retreating.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [submitting to Allah ].

Name: The Ant
Verse: And when the word befalls them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain [in faith].

Name: The Ant
Verse: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather from every nation a company of those who deny Our signs, and they will be [driven] in rows

Name: The Ant
Verse: Until, when they arrive [at the place of Judgement], He will say, "Did you deny My signs while you encompassed them not in knowledge, or what [was it that] you were doing?"

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the decree will befall them for the wrong they did, and they will not [be able to] speak.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Do they not see that We made the night that they may rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will be terrified except whom Allah wills. And all will come to Him humbled.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And you see the mountains, thinking them rigid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. [It is] the work of Allah , who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Acquainted with that which you do.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Whoever comes [at Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And whoever comes with an evil deed - their faces will be overturned into the Fire, [and it will be said], "Are you recompensed except for what you used to do?"

Name: The Ant
Verse: And to recite the Qur'an." And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself; and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."

Name: The Ant
Verse: And say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah . He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."

Name: The Story
Verse: Ta, Seen, Meem.

Name: The Story
Verse: These are the verses of the clear Book.

Name: The Story
Verse: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.

Name: The Story
Verse: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors

Name: The Story
Verse: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, "Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers."

Name: The Story
Verse: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

Name: The Story
Verse: And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not.

Name: The Story
Verse: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And she said to his sister, "Follow him"; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, "Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"

Name: The Story
Verse: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of the people do not know.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.

Name: The Story
Verse: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be an assistant to the criminals."

Name: The Story
Verse: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure], when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders."

Name: The Story
Verse: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."

Name: The Story
Verse: So he left it, fearful and anticipating [apprehension]. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he came to the well of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks], and he found aside from them two women driving back [their flocks]. He said, "What is your circumstance?" They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks]; and our father is an old man."

Name: The Story
Verse: So he watered [their flocks] for them; then he went back to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."

Name: The Story
Verse: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."

Name: The Story
Verse: One of the women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy."

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, "Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters, on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years; but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you. And I do not wish to put you in difficulty. You will find me, if Allah wills, from among the righteous."

Name: The Story
Verse: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves."

Name: The Story
Verse: But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot - from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allah , Lord of the worlds."

Name: The Story
Verse: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [ Allah said], "O Moses, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure.

Name: The Story
Verse: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white, without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed, I killed from among them someone, and I fear they will kill me.

Name: The Story
Verse: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue, so send him with me as support, verifying me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me."

Name: The Story
Verse: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, "This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."

Name: The Story
Verse: And Moses said, "My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home. Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."

Name: The Story
Verse: And Pharaoh said, "O eminent ones, I have not known you to have a god other than me. Then ignite for me, O Haman, [a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses. And indeed, I do think he is among the liars."

Name: The Story
Verse: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

Name: The Story
Verse: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.

Name: The Story
Verse: And you, [O Muhammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

Name: The Story
Verse: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].

Name: The Story
Verse: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.

Name: The Story
Verse: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"...

Name: The Story
Verse: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."

Name: The Story
Verse: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allah which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."

Name: The Story
Verse: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah ? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the Qur'an that they might be reminded.

Name: The Story
Verse: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed we were, [even] before it, Muslims [submitting to Allah ]."

Name: The Story
Verse: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we seek not the ignorant."

Name: The Story
Verse: Indeed, [O Muhammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

Name: The Story
Verse: And they say, "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we would be swept from our land." Have we not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.

Name: The Story
Verse: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.

Name: The Story
Verse: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?

Name: The Story
Verse: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is, on the Day of Resurrection, among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

Name: The Story
Verse: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"

Name: The Story
Verse: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we led to error. We led them to error just as we were in error. We declare our disassociation [from them] to You. They did not used to worship us."

Name: The Story
Verse: And it will be said, "Invoke your 'partners' " and they will invoke them; but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!

Name: The Story
Verse: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say, "What did you answer the messengers?"

Name: The Story
Verse: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

Name: The Story
Verse: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is promised by Allah that he will be among the successful.

Name: The Story
Verse: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.

Name: The Story
Verse: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

Name: The Story
Verse: And He is Allah ; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the [final] decision, and to Him you will be returned.

Name: The Story
Verse: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"

Name: The Story
Verse: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you a night in which you may rest? Then will you not see?"

Name: The Story
Verse: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

Name: The Story
Verse: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are my 'partners' which you used to claim?"

Name: The Story
Verse: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof," and they will know that the truth belongs to Allah , and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

Name: The Story
Verse: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he tyrannized them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men; thereupon his people said to him, "Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.

Name: The Story
Verse: But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters."

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, "I was only given it because of knowledge I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]? But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.

Name: The Story
Verse: So he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, "Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qarun. Indeed, he is one of great fortune."

Name: The Story
Verse: But those who had been given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for he who believes and does righteousness. And none are granted it except the patient."

Name: The Story
Verse: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah , nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

Name: The Story
Verse: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say, "Oh, how Allah extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it! If not that Allah had conferred favor on us, He would have caused it to swallow us. Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!"

Name: The Story
Verse: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

Name: The Story
Verse: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.

Name: The Story
Verse: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."

Name: The Story
Verse: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allah .

Name: The Story
Verse: And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Alif, Lam, Meem

Name: The Spider
Verse: Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?

Name: The Spider
Verse: But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Or do those who do evil deeds think they can outrun Us? Evil is what they judge.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Whoever should hope for the meeting with Allah - indeed, the term decreed by Allah is coming. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And whoever strives only strives for [the benefit of] himself. Indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to parents. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous [into Paradise].

Name: The Spider
Verse: And of the people are some who say, "We believe in Allah ," but when one [of them] is harmed for [the cause of] Allah , they consider the trial of the people as [if it were] the punishment of Allah . But if victory comes from your Lord, they say, "Indeed, We were with you." Is not Allah most knowing of what is within the breasts of all creatures?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Allah will surely make evident those who believe, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Follow our way, and we will carry your sins." But they will not carry anything of their sins. Indeed, they are liars.

Name: The Spider
Verse: But they will surely carry their [own] burdens and [other] burdens along with their burdens, and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: But We saved him and the companions of the ship, and We made it a sign for the worlds.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And [We sent] Abraham, when he said to his people, "Worship Allah and fear Him. That is best for you, if you should know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: You only worship, besides Allah , idols, and you produce a falsehood. Indeed, those you worship besides Allah do not possess for you [the power of] provision. So seek from Allah provision and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And if you [people] deny [the message] - already nations before you have denied. And there is not upon the Messenger except [the duty of] clear notification.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Have they not considered how Allah begins creation and then repeats it? Indeed that, for Allah , is easy.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how He began creation. Then Allah will produce the final creation. Indeed Allah , over all things, is competent."

Name: The Spider
Verse: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And you will not cause failure [to Allah ] upon the earth or in the heaven. And you have not other than Allah any protector or any helper.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And the ones who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And the answer of Abraham's people was not but that they said, "Kill him or burn him," but Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And [Abraham] said, "You have only taken, other than Allah , idols as [a bond of] affection among you in worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Lot believed him. [Abraham] said, "Indeed, I will emigrate to [the service of] my Lord. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We gave to Him Isaac and Jacob and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Indeed, you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Indeed, you approach men and obstruct the road and commit in your meetings [every] evil." And the answer of his people was not but they said, "Bring us the punishment of Allah , if you should be of the truthful."

Name: The Spider
Verse: He said, "My Lord, support me against the corrupting people."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that Lot's city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed for them and felt for them great discomfort. They said, "Fear not, nor grieve. Indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife; she is to be of those who remain behind.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Indeed, we will bring down on the people of this city punishment from the sky because they have been defiantly disobedient."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We have certainly left of it a sign as clear evidence for a people who use reason.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah and expect the Last Day and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

Name: The Spider
Verse: But they denied him, so the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud, and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings. And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds and averted them from the path, and they were endowed with perception.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And [We destroyed] Qarun and Pharaoh and Haman. And Moses had already come to them with clear evidences, and they were arrogant in the land, but they were not outrunners [of Our punishment].

Name: The Spider
Verse: So each We seized for his sin; and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them were those who were seized by the blast [from the sky], and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.

Name: The Spider
Verse: The example of those who take allies other than Allah is like that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Indeed, Allah knows whatever thing they call upon other than Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And these examples We present to the people, but none will understand them except those of knowledge.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows that which you do.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, "We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one; and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And thus We have sent down to you the Qur'an. And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture believe in it. And among these [people of Makkah] are those who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And you did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Otherwise the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Rather, the Qur'an is distinct verses [preserved] within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: But they say, "Why are not signs sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "The signs are only with Allah , and I am only a clear warner."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And is it not sufficient for them that We revealed to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and reminder for a people who believe.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Say, "Sufficient is Allah between me and you as Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and earth. And they who have believed in falsehood and disbelieved in Allah - it is those who are the losers."

Name: The Spider
Verse: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And if not for [the decree of] a specified term, punishment would have reached them. But it will surely come to them suddenly while they perceive not.

Name: The Spider
Verse: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers

Name: The Spider
Verse: On the Day the punishment will cover them from above them and from below their feet and it is said, "Taste [the result of] what you used to do."

Name: The Spider
Verse: O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Every soul will taste death. Then to Us will you be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will surely assign to them of Paradise [elevated] chambers beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers

Name: The Spider
Verse: Who have been patient and upon their Lord rely.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision. Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

Name: The Spider
Verse: If you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth and subjected the sun and the moon?" they would surely say, " Allah ." Then how are they deluded?

Name: The Spider
Verse: Allah extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And if you asked them, "Who sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?" they would surely say " Allah ." Say, "Praise to Allah "; but most of them do not reason.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement. And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life, if only they knew.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when they board a ship, they supplicate Allah , sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, at once they associate others with Him

Name: The Spider
Verse: So that they will deny what We have granted them, and they will enjoy themselves. But they are going to know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Have they not seen that We made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary, while people are being taken away all around them? Then in falsehood do they believe, and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Alif, Lam, Meem.

Name: The Romans
Verse: The Byzantines have been defeated

Name: The Romans
Verse: In the nearest land. But they, after their defeat, will overcome.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Within three to nine years. To Allah belongs the command before and after. And that day the believers will rejoice

Name: The Romans
Verse: In the victory of Allah . He gives victory to whom He wills, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Name: The Romans
Verse: They know what is apparent of the worldly life, but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Do they not contemplate within themselves? Allah has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in power, and they plowed the earth and built it up more than they have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear evidences. And Allah would not ever have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Then the end of those who did evil was the worst [consequence] because they denied the signs of Allah and used to ridicule them.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Allah begins creation; then He will repeat it; then to Him you will be returned.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will be in despair.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And there will not be for them among their [alleged] partners any intercessors, and they will [then] be disbelievers in their partners.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And the Day the Hour appears - that Day they will become separated.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And as for those who had believed and done righteous deeds, they will be in a garden [of Paradise], delighted.

Name: The Romans
Verse: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our verses and the meeting of the Hereafter, those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

Name: The Romans
Verse: So exalted is Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And to Him is [due all] praise throughout the heavens and the earth. And [exalted is He] at night and when you are at noon.

Name: The Romans
Verse: He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. And thus will you be brought out.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He created you from dust; then, suddenly you were human beings dispersing [throughout the earth].

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquillity in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is [that] He shows you the lightening [causing] fear and aspiration, and He sends down rain from the sky by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for a people who use reason.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth remain by His command. Then when He calls you with a [single] call from the earth, immediately you will come forth.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and earth. All are to Him devoutly obedient.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And it is He who begins creation; then He repeats it, and that is [even] easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest attribute in the heavens and earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

Name: The Romans
Verse: He presents to you an example from yourselves. Do you have among those whom your right hands possess any partners in what We have provided for you so that you are equal therein [and] would fear them as your fear of one another [within a partnership]? Thus do We detail the verses for a people who use reason.

Name: The Romans
Verse: But those who wrong follow their [own] desires without knowledge. Then who can guide one whom Allah has sent astray? And for them there are no helpers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the fitrah of Allah upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of Allah . That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord,

Name: The Romans
Verse: So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they were associating with Him?

Name: The Romans
Verse: And when We let the people taste mercy, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, immediately they despair.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Do they not see that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of Allah , and it is they who will be the successful.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And whatever you give for interest to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allah . But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of Allah - those are the multipliers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Allah is the one who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, and then will give you life. Are there any of your "partners" who does anything of that? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].

Name: The Romans
Verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were associators [of others with Allah ].

Name: The Romans
Verse: So direct your face toward the correct religion before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. That Day, they will be divided.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Whoever disbelieves - upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are for themselves preparing,

Name: The Romans
Verse: That He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy and so the ships may sail at His command and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear evidences; then We took retribution from those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the rain emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice

Name: The Romans
Verse: Although they were, before it was sent down upon them - before that, in despair.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allah - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.

Name: The Romans
Verse: But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disbelievers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [in submission to Allah ].

Name: The Romans
Verse: Allah is the one who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour. Thus they were deluded.

Name: The Romans
Verse: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "You remained the extent of Allah 's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not used to know."

Name: The Romans
Verse: So that Day, their excuse will not benefit those who wronged, nor will they be asked to appease [ Allah ].

Name: The Romans
Verse: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muhammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, "You [believers] are but falsifiers."

Name: The Romans
Verse: Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who do not know.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain [in faith].

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Alif, Lam, Meem.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: These are verses of the wise Book,

Name: Luqmân
Verse: As guidance and mercy for the doers of good

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Those are on [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of Allah without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And when our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the Gardens of Pleasure.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: This is the creation of Allah . So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to Allah ." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, "O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allah . Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice."

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys."

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Do you not see that Allah has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him].

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze?

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah will be the outcome of [all] matters.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And whoever has disbelieved - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive punishment.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth?" they would surely say, " Allah ." Say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah "; but most of them do not know.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that Allah , with whatever you do, is Acquainted?

Name: Luqmân
Verse: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of Allah that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate Allah , sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Indeed, Allah [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Alif, Lam, Meem.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Rather, it is the truth from your Lord, [O Muhammad], that you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you [so] perhaps they will be guided.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days; then He established Himself above the Throne. You have not besides Him any protector or any intercessor; so will you not be reminded?

Name: The Prostration
Verse: He arranges [each] matter from the heaven to the earth; then it will ascend to Him in a Day, the extent of which is a thousand years of those which you count.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: That is the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Who perfected everything which He created and began the creation of man from clay.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Then He made his posterity out of the extract of a liquid disdained.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Then He proportioned him and breathed into him from His [created] soul and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And they say, "When we are lost within the earth, will we indeed be [recreated] in a new creation?" Rather, they are, in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord, disbelievers.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Say, "The angel of death will take you who has been entrusted with you. Then to your Lord you will be returned."

Name: The Prostration
Verse: If you could but see when the criminals are hanging their heads before their Lord, [saying], "Our Lord, we have seen and heard, so return us [to the world]; we will work righteousness. Indeed, we are [now] certain."

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And if we had willed, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the word from Me will come into effect [that] "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and people all together.

Name: The Prostration
